intro: Leptocionium sororium, commonly known as the common goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, preferring well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters during the summer months. Leptocionium sororium is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
